alert.note: Alert for Dixie; Lafayette; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 10:51PM EDT until June 14 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Lafayette County in Big Bend of Florida... Dixie County in Big Bend of Florida... Southeastern Taylor County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 1051 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bell to 16 miles west of Steinhatchee, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cross City, Steinhatchee, Horseshoe Point, Suwannee, Horseshoe Beach, Tennille, Fish Creek, Shamrock, Howell Place, Clara, Cross City Airport, Shired Island, Old Town, Guaranto Springs, Jena, Hines, Jonesboro, Hatch Bend, Bird Island and Eugene. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for Big Bend of Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for Big Bend of Florida.
